intro: Pisum sativum var. sanguivittatum, commonly known as the crimson streaked pea, is a botanical variant of the common pea. It is characterized by its distinctive red streaks along the pod and seeds, which set it apart from standard pea varieties. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and tendrils for climbing. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and the pods are elongated with a slightly swollen appearance. This variety is primarily cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique coloration and aesthetic appeal.
